get.description: Get all available products and plans

get.description: Get a specific product by ID

post.description: Create a checkout session for either one-time payment or subscription

get.description:
Handle successful checkout completion
Returns either PaymentResponse for one-time payments or SubscriptionResponse for subscriptions

post.description: Cancel the current user's subscription
Create a customer portal session for subscription management

get.description: Get comprehensive payment information for the current user

post.description:
Handle Stripe webhook events
This endpoint is called by Stripe to notify about payment events

get.description:
Get comprehensive plan information for the current user.

Returns:
- Current plan level
- Available permissions
- Active subscription details
- Purchase history
- Feature breakdown by category

post.description:
Check if the current user has access to a specific feature.

This endpoint is useful for frontend components to determine
whether to show certain features or upgrade prompts.

get.description:
Get available plan upgrades for the current user.

Returns upgrade options with pricing and feature information.
Useful for displaying upgrade prompts and pricing pages.

schema.title: Response Get Available Upgrades Api Plans Upgrades Get

get.description:
Get all available features and their descriptions.

Useful for displaying feature comparison tables.

Get a comparison of all plans and their features.

Useful for pricing pages and plan comparison tables.

Get basic analytics for Starter+ users.

Includes:
- Total articles created
- Published vs draft count
- Recent activity summary

Requires: BASIC_ANALYTICS permission (Starter plan or higher)

schema.title: Response Get Basic Analytics Api Analytics Basic Get

get.description:
Get advanced analytics for Pro+ users.

Includes:
- Detailed performance metrics
- Monthly breakdown
- Content analysis
- Growth trends

Requires: ADVANCED_ANALYTICS permission (Pro plan or higher)

schema.title: Response Get Advanced Analytics Api Analytics Advanced Get

get.description:
Get premium reporting features for Premium+ subscribers.

Includes:
- Custom report generation
- Data export options
- Benchmarking data
- Advanced filtering

Requires: ADVANCED_REPORTING permission (Premium subscription or higher)

schema.title: Response Get Premium Reporting Api Analytics Reporting Get

get.description:
Get team analytics for Enterprise subscribers.

Includes:
- Team performance metrics
- Collaboration insights
- Resource utilization
- Team productivity reports

Requires: TEAM_MANAGEMENT permission (Enterprise subscription)

schema.title: Response Get Team Analytics Api Analytics Team Get

get.description:
Get all available integrations based on user's plan.

Returns different integration tiers:
- Basic: Available to all plans
- Premium: Available to Premium+ subscribers
- Enterprise: Available to Enterprise subscribers only

schema.title: Response Get Available Integrations Api Integrations Get

get.description:
Get status of all configured integrations for the current user.

Shows which integrations are active, configured, or need attention.

schema.title: Response Get Integration Status Api Integrations Status Get

get.description:
Get detailed information about a specific integration.

Includes setup instructions, features, and access requirements.

schema.title: Response Get Integration Details Api Integrations  Integration Id  Get

post.description:
Set up and configure a new integration.

Requires appropriate plan permissions for the integration type.

schema.title: Response Setup Integration Api Integrations  Integration Id  Setup Post

get.description:
Get available upgrade options for the current user.

Returns upgrade paths with pricing, proration info, and feature comparisons.
Includes trial information for new subscriptions and proration details for upgrades.

schema.title: Response Get Upgrade Options Api Upgrades Options Get

post.description:
Create checkout session for plan upgrade.

Handles:
- One-time plan purchases (Starter, Pro)
- New subscription creation (Premium, Enterprise)
- Subscription upgrades with proration
- Trial periods for new subscriptions

schema.title: Response Create Upgrade Checkout Api Upgrades Checkout Post

post.description:
Get proration preview for subscription upgrade.

Shows exactly how much the user will be charged today and explains
the billing cycle changes without creating a checkout session.

schema.title: Response Get Proration Preview Api Upgrades Proration Preview Post

get.description: Get a page by ID.

post.description: Create a new page.

get.description: Get all data for a page.

schema.title: Response Get Page Data Api Pages  Page Id  Data Get

post.description:
Start a new crawl job for a project.

This endpoint initiates a background crawl job that will:
1. Discover URLs from sitemap or crawling
2. Test multiple extraction methods
3. Extract content from all pages using the best method

Args:
    request: Request containing project_id
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    StartCrawlResponse with job details

get.description:
Get the status of a crawl job.

Args:
    crawl_job_id: The crawl job ID
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    CrawlJobStatusResponse with job status

post.description:
Manually add a page URL to a project.

Args:
    request: Request containing project_id and URL
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    AddManualPageResponse with page details

get.description:
Get all pages for a project.

Args:
    project_id: The project ID
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    List of PageDetailResponse

schema.title: Response Get Project Pages Api Crawl Project  Project Id  Pages Get

get.description:
Get all crawl jobs for a project.

Args:
    project_id: The project ID
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    List of CrawlJobStatusResponse

schema.title: Response Get Project Crawl Jobs Api Crawl Project  Project Id  Crawl Jobs Get

post.description:
Cancel a running crawl job.

Args:
    request: Request containing crawl_job_id
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    CancelCrawlJobResponse with cancellation result

Re-scan sitemap and detect changes.

Compares current sitemap with existing pages and returns:
- New URLs discovered
- URLs removed from sitemap
- Unchanged URLs

Args:
    request: Request containing project_id
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    RescanSitemapResponse with diff results

Scrape selected pages using specified extraction method.

Args:
    request: Request containing page_ids and extraction_method
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    ScrapeSelectedPagesResponse with scraping results

get.description:
Get all pages for a project with crawl statistics.

Includes current page data, version count, and crawl status.

Args:
    project_id: The project ID
    current_user: Authenticated user
    db: Database session

Returns:
    List of PageWithStatsResponse

schema.title: Response Get Project Pages With Stats Api Crawl Project  Project Id  Pages With Stats Get

post.description:
Create a new research request and optionally start execution in background.

Args:
    research_data: Research request parameters
    background_tasks: FastAPI background tasks
    db: Database session
    current_user: Current authenticated user

Returns:
    Created research request

get.description:
Get all research requests for the current user.

Args:
    skip: Number of records to skip
    limit: Maximum number of records to return
    db: Database session
    current_user: Current authenticated user

Returns:
    List of research requests

schema.title: Response List Research Api Research Get

get.description:
Get detailed information about a specific research request.

Args:
    research_id: UUID of the research request
    db: Database session
    current_user: Current authenticated user

Returns:
    Detailed research request with sources and report

delete.description:
Delete a research request and all associated data.

Args:
    research_id: UUID of the research request
    db: Database session
    current_user: Current authenticated user

Returns:
    Success message

post.description:
Cancel a running research request.

Args:
    research_id: UUID of the research request
    db: Database session
    current_user: Current authenticated user

Returns:
    Updated research request with cancelled status

Chat with AI about research results.

Args:
    research_id: UUID of the research request
    message: User's chat message
    db: Database session
    current_user: Current authenticated user

Returns:
    Chat response containing both user message and AI response
